Package edu.rpi.legup.history

Class PuzzleCommand

java.lang.Object
edu.rpi.legup.history.PuzzleCommand
All Implemented Interfaces:
ICommand
Direct Known Subclasses:
AddTreeElementCommand, ApplyDefaultDirectRuleCommand, AutoCaseRuleCommand, ClueCommand, DeleteTreeElementCommand, EditDataCommand, EditLineCommand, EditLineCommand, MergeCommand, ValidateCaseRuleCommand, ValidateContradictionRuleCommand, ValidateDirectRuleCommand
public abstract class PuzzleCommand extends Object implements ICommand
The PuzzleCommand class is an abstract base class for commands that can be executed, undone, and redone within the puzzle model. It implements the ICommand interface and maintains the state and error handling for the command.

    • getError

      public final String getError()
      Gets the reason why the command cannot be executed
      Specified by:
      getError in interface ICommand
      Returns:
      if command cannot be executed, returns reason for why the command cannot be executed, otherwise null if command can be executed

    • getErrorString

      public abstract String getErrorString()
      Gets the reason why the command cannot be executed
      Returns:
      if command cannot be executed, returns reason for why the command cannot be executed, otherwise null if command can be executed

    • executeCommand

      public abstract void executeCommand()
      Executes the command. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define the command's execution behavior.

    • undoCommand

      public abstract void undoCommand()
      Undoes the command. This method must be implemented by subclasses to define the command's undo behavior.

    • redoCommand

      public void redoCommand()
      Redoes the command. This method is called if the command was previously undone.

      Undoes the command if it was executed or redone
